sn22.76:1.5: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.76:1.12: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.76:2.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn22.76:2.2: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn22.76:2.3: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’
sn22.76:2.4: As far as there are abodes of sentient beings, even up until the pinnacle of existence, the perfected ones are the foremost and the best.”
sn22.76:3.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn22.76:3.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn22.76:4.1: “Oh! How happy are the perfected ones!
sn22.76:4.2: Craving is not found in them,
sn22.76:4.3: the conceit ‘I am’ is cut off,
sn22.76:4.4: and the net of delusion is shattered.
sn22.76:5.3: nothing in the world clings to them,
sn22.76:6.2: their domain is the seven good qualities.
sn22.76:7.2: and trained in the three trainings,
sn22.76:7.4: with fear and dread given up.
sn22.76:8.2: those giants are immersed in samādhi.
sn22.76:8.3: They are the best in the world,
sn22.76:8.4: craving is not found in them.
sn22.76:9.2: ‘This bag of bones is my last.’
sn22.76:9.4: in the core of the spiritual path.
sn22.76:10.1: They do not waver due to the discriminations,
sn22.76:10.3: They’ve reached the level of the tamed,
sn22.76:10.4: in the world, they’re the winners.
sn22.76:11.2: relishing is not found in them.
sn22.76:11.4: ‘The awakened are supreme in the world!’”
